City Council
============

City Council Members outside city hall
--------------------------------------

As the governing body of the City of Texarkana, Texas, it is the City Council’s responsibility to represent the best interests of all citizens in Texarkana, Texas, in determining the city policies and plans, enacting local legislation and adopting the city’s budget.

* [Bob Bruggeman, Mayor](https://www.texarkanatexas.gov/302/Bob-Bruggeman-Mayor)
* [Jean H. Matlock, Ward 1](https://www.texarkanatexas.gov/304/Jean-H-Matlock-Ward-1)
* [Mary Hart, Ward 2](https://www.texarkanatexas.gov/305/Mary-Hart-Ward-2)
* [Steve Thompson, Ward 3](https://texarkanatexas.gov/308/Steve-Thompson-Ward-3)
* [Christie Page, Ward 4](https://www.texarkanatexas.gov/309/Christie-Alcorn-Ward-4)
* [Cole Meador, Ward 5](https://texarkanatexas.gov/310/Cole-Meador-Ward-5)
* [Jay Davis, Ward 6](https://texarkanatexas.gov/312/Jay-Davis-Ward-6)

City council meetings will be held on the second Monday of each month at 6:00 p.m. in the Council Chambers on the 2nd floor of Texarkana, Texas City Hall, 220 Texas Boulevard, Texarkana, Texas.

City Petition Policy - To submit a petition to the City Council, follow the instructions outlined in the Citizen Petition Policy ([PDF](https://texarkanatexas.gov/DocumentCenter/View/4423/Citizen-Petition-Policy-2024)).

Proclamation Request - Complete this [form (PDF)](https://www.texarkanatexas.gov/DocumentCenter/View/2962) and submit to the City Secretary, Jennifer Evans, [by email](mailto:j.evans@texarkanatexas.gov)or City Hall - City Secretary's Suite, 2nd Floor.

To determine in which ward you reside, please refer to this[map](https://texarkanatexas.gov/DocumentCenter/View/10506/CityWardsLetter2024). If you are still unsure or have trouble using this map, please call 903-798-3835.
